page.title: 08A Large Estate in Wolsingham
page.content: One of the largest landowners is Mr Tom Fenwick of{Bishop Oak,}part of whose estate is included in this area. His four farms are let to tenants,who graze sheep and cattle and produce some barley,hay and silage. Mr Fenwick,after 30 years farming realises that only some innovations will work in this area.The main changes have been the{reduction in {manpower due to mechanisation}and the increasing use of{contractors}to carry out specific tasks. Mr Fenwick owns extensive{woodland producing timber for furniture.The management of trees is one of his main concerns.The woods provide cover for {game birds. Mr Fenwick is a conservationist and a supporter of fox hunting.He believes that{town people}have an{unrealistic and{overromantic view}of the country.
